data.title: Thunderbird Entertainment at Atomic Cartoons
data.text:
Are you an experienced Paralegal with 3 or more years experience focused on Securities. Atomic Cartoon's parent company Thunderbird Entertainment is seeking an experienced Paralegal to join our Legal and Business Affairs team.

Thunderbird Entertainment Group is a global award-winning, full-service multiplatform production, distribution and rights management company, headquartered in Vancouver, with offices in Los Angeles and Ottawa. Thunderbird creates award-winning scripted, unscripted, and animated programming for the world’s leading digital platforms, as well as Canadian and international broadcasters. Thunderbird develops, produces, and distributes animated, factual, and scripted content through its various content arms, including Thunderbird Kids and Family (Atomic Cartoons), Thunderbird Unscripted (Great Pacific Media) and Thunderbird Scripted.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Assist and support the Legal and Business Affairs team with production and regulatory matters.

Draft corporate filings and assist with continuous disclosure documents.

Prepare and complete filings via SEDAR+ and SEDI.

Prepare meeting minutes.

Manage the distribution database and assist with tracking distribution and sales agreements.

Assist with scheduling meetings and track important dates/deadlines.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

3+ Years experience as a Securities Paralegal.

A Paralegal diploma from a recognized institution.

Prior experience filing via SEDAR+ and SEDI.

Familiarity with GSuite and Microsoft Office Suite.

Demonstrated proficiency in reviewing and interpreting contracts.

Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently in a hybrid work environment.

Strong organizational and time management skills.

A desire to learn about the entertainment industry.

Prior experience within the film/entertainment industry is an asset.

START DATE: August 2024

This is currently a Hybrid role. Remote/Work from 3 days a week. 2 days of the week are in office at our Vancouver offices in Mt Pleasant. This is subject to change based on department needs.

INTERESTED?

Atomic Cartoons Inc. and Thunderbird Entertainment welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Show us what you would like to contribute to Atomic by providing us with relevant examples of your previous work along with your resume and cover letter .

We thank you for your submission; only short-listed candidates will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

Atomic Cartoons is an equal opportunity employer and employs personnel without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, language, citizenship, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical and/or mental handicap or financial ability.

While remaining sensitive, fair, and providing equitable treatment for all, Atomic Cartoons works to increase participation and advancement to reflect all personnel – including Women, Indigenous People, Visible Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities, who are all qualified members. Thus, it helps identify and remove barriers that prevent the full participation of members of designated groups in the workplace.
